definition-item.definition-title: LUBRICATING

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Constructional modifications of parts of machines or apparatus for the purposes of lubrication.

Devices for supplying lubricant, e.g. oil or grease, from a stationary or movable reservoir to the machine or member to be lubricated, or for supplying lubricant by manual action or by a hand-positioned nozzle with lubricant under pressure.
Lubrication using substances other than oil or grease.
Lubrication characterised by the use of particular lubricants in particular apparatus or conditions.
Lubrication of apparatus working in extreme conditions.
Details of lubricators or lubrication systems, e.g. reservoirs, conduits, check valves, distributing equipment, collecting or draining lubricant, cleaning.
Safety devices for indication or detection of undesired conditions, or use of devices responsive to conditions in lubricating arrangements or systems.
Care of lubricants, e.g. storage, transfer.
Conditioning lubricants, e.g. by heating, cooling, filtering, diluting.

section-body.paragraph-text: F16N is the general or function-oriented subclass for lubrication subject-matter, but there are many application-oriented places in the Classification where subject-matter for specially-adapted forms of lubrication can be found (see the references below). Lubrication specially adapted to machines or apparatus provided for in a single other class is covered by the relevant class for that machine or apparatus.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes for applying liquids or other fluent materials to a surface, to obtain an anti-friction surface
Lubricating compositions; Selection of particular substances as lubricants

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubrication of mandrels for metal tube rolling mills
Lubrication of rolls for metal rolling mills
Lubrication of tools for machines for working metal without removing material
Lubrication of moulds for continuous casting of metals
Lubrication of portable power-driven percussive tools
Lubrication of band saw blades for wood or the like
Arrangements or adaptations of lubricating systems or devices in vehicles
Lubrication of cable systems for railways
Lubrication of rail or wheel flanges of railways
Vehicle endless-track units with lubrication means
Lubrication of ropes, cables or guides of elevators
Lubrication of spindles of machines for spinning or twisting threads or fibres
Lubricating details of roller drill bits for earth drilling
Lubrication of rotary-piston or oscillating-piston machines or engines
Lubrication of non-positive displacement machines or engines, e.g. steam turbines, Windmill
Lubrication of machines or apparatus working under extreme conditions, at high temperature, of turbines
Lubrication of cylinders of combustion engines
Lubrication of pumps for elastic fluids
Lubrication of rotary-piston or oscillating-piston pumps for elastic fluids
Lubrication of ball or roller bearings
Oil separators for separating oil from exhaust steam
Lubrication of rotary anodes of X-ray tubes
Lubrication of rotary current collectors, distributors or interrupters

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storage containers; draining equipment for liquid containers
Composite materials or sliding materials in which lubricants are integrally moulded
Lubrication of machines or engines in general, including internal-combustion engines

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: any fluid (e.g. water, oil), fluent material (e.g. particulate graphite), semi-fluid material (e.g. oil with thickener), or semisolid material (e.g. grease), or any mixture of such types of substance, which is used for the specific purpose of lubrication.

apparatus, arrangements or methods for introducing or applying a thin layer of a discrete lubricant between two or more relatively-moving adjacent solid surfaces of a device or apparatus, for the specific purpose of reducing friction, heat or wear between the adjacent surfaces.

definition-item.definition-title: Constructional modifications of parts of machines or apparatus for the purpose of lubrication

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Modifying portions of a work device for the supply or transfer of lubricant, or altering the moving portions of a work device to facilitate reducing friction that could respectively not be covered by a specific application for lubrication (see list of references relevant to classification mentioned above such as. B62J31/00: Lubrication of cycles). This group is seldom used.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubrication of sliding contact of ball bearing

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for supplying lubricant by manual action (draining equipment for liquid containers B65D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements for supplying lubricant such as delivering oil (i.e. oil cans or oil syringes), as well delivering grease (i.e. grease guns)(the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hand-actuated arrangements for supplying grease from a stationary reservoir or the equivalent in or on the machine or member to be lubricated
Hand or foot actuated Lubricating-pumps with reciprocating piston

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus with hand-positioned nozzle supplied with lubricant under pressure (F16N3/00 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Apparatus with hand-positioned nozzle supplied with lubricant under pressure, or Nozzles or nozzle-valve arrangements therefor (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for supplying lubricant by manual action (draining equipment for liquid containers

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for supplying oil or unspecified lubricant from a stationary reservoir or the equivalent in or on the machine or member to be lubricated

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements for supplying oil or unspecified lubricant from a stationary reservoir or the equivalent in or on the machine or member to be lubricated such as e.g. with gravity feed or drip lubrication, splash lubrication, dip lubrication, mist lubrication, with feed by pumping action of the member to be lubricated or of a shaft of the machine, centrifugal lubrication, with feed by pumping action of a vertical shaft of the machine, and central lubrication systems (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).

definition-item.definition-title: controlled by means of the temperature of the member to be lubricated (thermostats G05D)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: the lubricant being conveyed from the reservoir by mechanical means (by pumping devices F16N7/36, F16N7/38; adaptations for lubrication of machines or engines in general, of internal-combustion engines F01M)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adaptations for lubrication of machines or engines in general, of internal-combustion engines

definition-item.definition-title: the oil being carried up by a lifting device (scoop devices in general F04D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Mechanisms to raise the elevation of lubrication such as scoops, the oil being carried up by a lifting device with one or more feed members fixed on a shaft, with one or more members moving around the shaft to be lubricated (i.e shaped as rings), or with discs, rollers, belts or the like contacting the shaft to be lubricated (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples)
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Splash lubrication (mist lubrication F16N7/32)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Details of splash lubrication through projection of lubricant involving dipper, nozzle, sprinkling, spraying or diffusing device (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Jetting means for lubricating of machines or engines in general
Machines or engines in general with dip or splash lubrication
Gearing with lubrication by injection; Injection nozzles or tubes therefor

definition-item.definition-title: the oil being fed or carried along by another fluid (in internal- combustion engines F02F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Lubrication means whereby, the oil being fed or carried along by another fluid (air, water etc…), whereby the other fluid being intentionally introduced. (For instance, an oil flow containing accidentally some air, either ahead of the oil or in the oil, i.e., bubbles, is not covered) (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Mist lubrication (splash lubrication F16N7/26)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gearing with oil-mist or spray lubrication.

definition-item.definition-title: Atomising devices for oil (atomising devices in general B05B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for supplying oil or unspecified lubricant from a moving reservoir or the equivalent (also usable with a stationary reservoir F16N7/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements for supplying oil or unspecified lubricant from a moving reservoir or the equivalent such as e.g. a reservoir on or in a rotary member and a reservoir on or in a reciprocating, rocking, or swinging member (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Also usable with a stationary reservoir

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for supplying grease from a stationary reservoir or the equivalent in or on the machine or member to be lubricated; Grease cups

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements for supplying grease from a stationary reservoir or the equivalent in or on the machine or member to be lubricated such as e.g. grease cups, hand-actuated grease cups, stauffer cups, spring-loaded devices, weight-loaded devices, or by pressure of another fluid (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).This group cover some structure to facilitate the higher (for lubricating-pumps see F16N13/00)

definition-item.definition-title: Lubricating-pumps (oil cans with pump F16N3/08; pumps for liquids in general F04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Lubricating-pumps such as e.g. with a reciprocating piston, with an adjustable reciprocating pumps, an actuation of lubricating-pumps by hand or foot, a mechanical drive, or fluid drive, with relative movement of pump parts being produced by inertia of one of the parts or of a driving member, with a rotary pumps, or with distributing equipment (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with reciprocating piston (pumps with distributing equipment F16N13/22)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Rotary pumps (with distributing equipment F16N13/22)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with distributing equipment (separate distributing equipment F16N25/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Pump with distributing equipment, whereby the distributing equipment is seen as mean to split a lubricant flow into multiple flows for different users or channels or pipes (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubricant containers for use in lubricators or lubrication systems
Conduits; Junctions ; Fittings for lubrication apertures

definition-item.definition-title: Lubrication with substances other than oil or grease; Lubrication characterised by the use of particular lubricants in particular apparatus or conditions (F16N17/00 takes precedence; lubricating compositions, selection of particular substances as lubricants in general C10M)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Lubrication with substances other than oil or grease such as e.g. with graphite or graphite-containing compositions or water (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubrication of machines or apparatus working under extreme conditions

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubricating compositions, selection of particular substances as lubricants in general

definition-item.definition-title: with water (bearings working in water F16C)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Lubrication of machines or apparatus working under extreme conditions (additives to lubricating oil or lubricating grease C10M)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Lubrication of machines or apparatus working under extreme conditions such as e.g. at high temperature, at low temperature, or in vacuum or under reduced pressure (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Additives to lubricating oil or lubricating grease

definition-item.definition-title: at high temperature (of turbines F01D, F02C; lubrication of machines or engines in general, of internal-combustion engines F01M)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubrication of machines or engines in general, of internal-combustion engines

definition-item.definition-title: at low temperature (lubrication of refrigerating machines F25B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: in vacuum or under reduced pressure (lubrication of evacuating pumps F04; of rotary anodes of X-ray tubes H01J35/10)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubrication of rotary anodes of X-ray tubes

definition-item.definition-title: Lubricant containers for use in lubricators or lubrication systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Lubricant containers for use in lubricators or lubrication systems, such as e.g. indicating oil level or maintaining oil level (the scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).

definition-item.definition-title: {Indicating oil level (measuring liquid level in general G01F)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Maintaining oil level (level control in general G05D9/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for maintaining oil level such as float valve refill systems (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for keeping lubricant level constant

definition-item.definition-title: Conduits; Junctions (in general F16L); Fittings for lubrication apertures

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Conduits; junctions; fittings for lubrication apertures such as e.g. lubricating nipples, nozzles for connection of lubricating equipment to nipples Covering members for nipples, conduits or apertures (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Special adaptations of check valves (check valves in general F16K)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Distributing equipment {with or without proportioning devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Distributing equipment, whereby the distributing equipment is seen as mean to split a lubricant flow into multiple flows for different users or channels or pipes such as e.g. with reciprocating distributing slide valve or with rotary distributing member (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Distributing member combined with oil pump
Lubricant containers for use in lubricators or lubrication systems
Conduits; Junctions ; Fittings for lubrication apertures

definition-item.definition-title: Proportioning devices (liquid meters G01F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Proportioning devices such as e.g. using restrictions or gating equipment (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Gating equipment (multiple-way valves F16K; metering cocks G01F)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Special means in lubricating arrangements or systems providing for the indication or detection of undesired conditions; Use of devices responsive to conditions in lubricating arrangements or systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Special means in lubricating arrangements or systems providing for the indication or detection of undesired conditions (i.e excessive temperature, lack of lubricant, lubricant composition out of limits, excessive pressure, clogging, etc...); Use of devices responsive to conditions in lubricating arrangements or systems such as e.g. for influencing the supply of lubricant or enabling a warning to be given (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Use of devices responsive to conditions in lubricating arrangements or systems in bearings

definition-item.definition-title: Means for collecting, retaining, or draining-off lubricant in or on machines or apparatus (oil separators for separating oil from exhaust steam F22G)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Means for collecting, retaining, or draining-off lubricant in or on machines or apparatus, such as e.g. drain pans, drip trays, oil catchers, oil wipers (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Oil separators for separating oil from exhaust steam

definition-item.definition-title: Oil catchers; Oil wipers (oil-scraping rings for pistons F16J9/20 {; cleaning means for indicating or measuring dip members, e.g. dipstick wipers G01F23/045})

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cleaning means for indicating or measuring dip members, e.g. dipstick wipers

definition-item.definition-title: Mechanical arrangements for cleaning lubricating equipment; Special racks or the like for use in draining lubricant from machine parts

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Mechanical arrangements for cleaning lubricating equipment; Special racks or the like for use in draining lubricant from machine parts such as flushing and steam cleaners (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).

definition-item.definition-title: Storage of lubricants in engine-rooms or the like (storage containers B65)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for conditioning of lubricants in the lubricating system (cleaning of lubricating oil, lubricating compositions C10M)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangements for conditioning (i.e. altering the viscosity) of lubricants in the lubricating system such as e.g. by deaeration, by evaporating or purifying, by cooling, by heating, by filtration or by diluting, e.g. by addition of fuel (The scope covered the by title of the corresponding group is not limited by these examples).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cleaning of lubricating oil, lubricating compositions

definition-item.definition-title: {by deaeration (degasification of liquids B01D19/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {by evaporating or purifying (for heating or cooling of filters B01D35/18, e.g. comprising a vaporising unit B01D35/185)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For heating or cooling of filters
For heating or cooling of filters, e.g. comprising a vaporising unit

definition-item.definition-title: by cooling (heat-exchangers in general F28)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: by heating (heat-exchangers in general F28)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: by filtration (filters in general B01D; magnetic separators B03C1/00; {centrifugal separators or filters B04B5/005})

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
